Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, Phil recruited me to sell these cards, and now I am recruiting you.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Who is this guy again?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't worry about Phil. He drives a corvette. He is doing just fine. Okay. Calling cards are... the wave of the future. These things sell themselves.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Who uses calling cards anymore?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? That's a nice attitude, Ryan, I'm just helping you invest in your future, my friend.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: This sounds like a get rich quick scheme.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes! Thank you! You will get rich quick. We all will!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Didn't you lose a lot of money on that other investment, the one from the email?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what, Toby? When the son of the deposed king of Nigeria emails you directly, asking for help, you help! His father ran the freaking country, okay? ...Alright, so, raise your hand if you wanna get rich. [Jim and Dwight raise their hands] Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, um. How is this not a pyramid scheme?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, let me explain. Again. [draws on board] Phil has recruited me and another guy. Now, we are getting three people each. The more people that get involved, the more who are investing, the more money we're all going to make. It's not a pyramid scheme, it is a... it's not even a scheme per se, it's... [Jim draws a triangle around Michael's diagram] ... I have to go make a call.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Happy birthday Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh ho ho! What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I said happy birthday.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you! That's really nice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Today is my B-day, and people around here just go crazy for it. I don't know why. Oh! Fun fact. I share my birthday with Eva Longoria. So, I have a perfect ice-breaker if I ever meet Terry Hatcher.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey. ...Oh, happy birthday.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, thank you sir.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Did you hear anything yet?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No. I'm still waiting.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Dwight knocks on door] Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes. There he is, the birthday boy!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ohh, god.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Birthday hug!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No no no, no, new suit, please.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That suit is amazing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you very much. It is from Italy. [checks jacket] Actually-- no, Bulgaria.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mmm. Maybe I should get one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good luck. One of a kind.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ebay. Hm. Question! May I be in charge of the party planning festivities?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Not necessary, the party planning committee is all over it. They've been working twenty-four seven all day yesterday.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Excellent. On my part, I did manage to reserve the...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't! Nope! Please, don't want to spoil it for anybody. Spoil the surprise.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's get the party started. [Begins 'raising the roof']

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's get the party started. Not the way I taught you! [Michael joins in]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: When should we bring out the cake, one or one thirty?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: One's good.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: One thirty. [Pam yawns] I'm sorry, are we boring you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Party planning committee, listen up. Michael would like trick candles for his birthday cake, so make that a priority.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Where do we get those?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Not my problem. Here is a list of things that Michael would like to be surprised by. [hands list to Pam]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael wants a strippergram?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, but he doesn't want to know when, or whom.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No. This is a closed door meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [answering phone] Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, I have Jan on the line.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, great, put her through.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Hello, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, you.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I'm... returning your call, you said it was urgent.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is urgent, I just wanted to call and wish you a happy birthday.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, today's not my birthday, so...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? 'Cause, I thought we had the same birthday.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: ...Happy birthday, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thanks. [grins]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Am I on camera?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nope. Totally private. You can say whatever is in your heart. [Jan hangs up]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to Ryan, sitting across from Michael] ...You can take a five, if you want.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Somebody brought in donuts for my birthday!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Mmhmm, happy birthday.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Man, I'm so sorry. When do you find out?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: They said this afternoon. They're waiting on a second opinion.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Second opinion on what?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Um, I might have skin cancer.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, no! I was watching Grey's Anatomy, and there was a lifeguard on it, and he had skin cancer too.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Kelly, you know what...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I never really thought about death until Princess Diana died. That was the saddest funeral ever. That and my sister's.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Who brought in donuts?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Somebody got donuts for my birthday!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Happy birthday!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You didn't know it was my birthday.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I... guess I forgot.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I guess I forgot to give you a donut [closes box].

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Are you serious?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Skin cancer is treatable.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's going to be okay.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You don't know it's going to be okay. Don't give him false hope. ...It's probably nothing, though.

Quote.Speaker: Delivery Woman
Quote.Text: Hi, delivery for Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here we go. Ohhhkay, this is great! [giggles] Thank you my friends, she is perfect! Ahhh, Dwight, may I have your chair please? And, um, some singles, if you will! Allllright. Nnnnn-dink! [puts single into delivery woman's pocket, giggles] Okay, um, alright. This has arms. Is that gonna be a... is that alright?

Quote.Speaker: Delivery Woman
Quote.Text: Uh... s-sure.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughing] Okay. I'm so nervous.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I can sign for it.

Quote.Speaker: Delivery Woman
Quote.Text: Oh. Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When I was seven, my mother hired a pony and a cart to come to my house for all the kids... and... I got a really bad rash from the pony, and all the kids got to ride the pony and I had to go inside, and my mother was rubbing cream on me... for probably three hours, and I never came outside. And by the time I got out the pony was already in the truck. And around the corner. So that was my worst birthday.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [eating donuts while Dwight plays the recorder] Stop it. Stop! What is that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's 'For the Longest Time,' by William Joel. It's you favorite song.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, well, it's on the radio. My birthday blows. Nobody even signed my birthday poster. Probably my mother is the only one that cares enough to send me anything.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I probably care more than she does.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're making it worse. I bet Luke Perry's friends don't treat him like this [points to James Dean poster].

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: When does he hear?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sometime today.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ohh... poor Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: If I knew I had a week to live, I would... probably go to Europe. And South America. And the Grand Canyon. And... I would want to see the Pacific Ocean. ...It would be a pretty busy week.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, that's a list price of four dollars and fifty cents. Unfortunately, this item is on [watch beeps] back... order... [hangs up] Michael! Michael! Michael Michael Michael! Come here, come here, come here! Come here!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Listen up everyone! It is 11:23 exactly, the exact moment when you emerged from your mother's vaginal canal, so... huh?! Right, have a seat. Please.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [grinning] Ohhh, God.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There is a tradition that the Hebrews have of hoisting the birthday boy up on a chair.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ohhh, no.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So come help me celebrate Michael's birth moment. Kevin!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: ...I'll do it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ohh, no, no, no! I can't... Ryan, come on. Let's do this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Creed! Come on. Stanley!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: ...I feel like we should go get Kevin something. Do you think we can sneak out of here?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Maybe, but... we're gonna need somebody to create a diversion, and...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: On three, we're going to hoist away! Ready?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Happy birth moment, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: One. Two. Three! [Michael is raised until his head hits the ceiling]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whoa whoa! Alright. Alright. Watch it... please.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oscar...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It wasn't me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, that is not an eight foot sub.

Quote.Speaker: Delivery Boy
Quote.Text: Uh, we don't make an eight foot sub. This is eight one foot subs.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: F. Alright, what's the damage?

Quote.Speaker: Delivery Boy
Quote.Text: Uh, thirty-nine sixty.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [pulls out wallet] Thirty nine... sixty.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why tip someone for a job I'm capable of doing myself? I can deliver food. I can drive a taxi. I can, and do, cut my own hair. I did, however, tip my urologist, because... I am unable to pulverize my own kidney stones.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Here they come.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Get in here... everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come and get it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Birthday party subs! My gift to you.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What is this?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, bologna, tomato and ketchup.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The best.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: These are all the same?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Bologna? I don't eat bologna.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, then just have the tomato and ketchup. Still good.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just the bread, it's fresh baked.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm-kay. Get whatever you want. [under breath] And choke on it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When I was sixteen, I was supposed to go out on a date with a girl named Julie. But there was another Michael in the class that she apparently thought the date was with, so she went out with him, on my birthday. And, she got him a cake, at the restaurant. And it wasn't even his birthday, but I heard about it the next day in school. So... That was the worst birthday I think I ever had.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So. We got Kev some stuff. Um... a party pack of M&M's, his favorite candy. A DVD of American Pie 2, which is his favorite movie, and, he lent it to Creed, so, I can guarantee you he won't get that back.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sixty-nine cup of noodles.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Which we realize sounds crass, but, it... is his favorite number.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And his favorite lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey temp, you know uh, we still got five feet of sandwich left [pulls ice cream cake out of freezer].

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [making peanut butter and jelly sandwich] Someone ate three feet of that thing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hell, yeah. Save room for ice cream cake.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [grabs cake] Oh. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh. I got it.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What are-- it's... the party planning committee.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [whispering] This is the most important day of the year. I can't risk anything.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Fine.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What about that meeting... later... to discuss finances?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes... [whispering] but don't expect any cookie.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [whispering] But what if i'm hungry?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [whispering] No cookie.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [puts fabric softener into cart] ...What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You use fabric softener?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, you don't?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: ...Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Office Staff
Quote.Text: [singing] Happy birthday dear Michael, [Michael joins in, Kevin's phone rings] Happy birthday... [everyone but Dwight stops] ...tooo youuuu.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hello? Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kevin? Respect the birthday please.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No, um, no not yet. I will. Bye. [hangs up] It was just Stacy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are you done? ...Good. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Here we go. Make a wish.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uhhh... blow out the candle. Okay. Mmmm... [blows out the candles]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yaoo yay! [claps]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ... I asked for trick candles.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam was supposed to get 'em.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Well, when she comes back we'll do it again. [notices Meredith hugging Kevin] Hello, what about the birthday boy? Haven't had a hug all day.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No one cares about your birthday. Kevin's waiting to hear if he has skin cancer.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ... Aww, that... sucks, great. ... Wow, that's good timing. That's... that's, sorry, that's terrible. Terrible news. That's terrible... terrible news for both of us [takes cake into office and slams the door].

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [checking watch] We should probably head back.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Okay. Oh. I dare you to make an announcement.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You dare me? How old are you?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Just... quit stalling.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [over loudspeaker, imitating Darth Vader] Luke, this is your father. Come set the table for dinner.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Such a dork.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [loudspeaker] Jim Halpert? Price check on fabric softener, the kind that gives you...

Quote.Speaker: Store Employee
Quote.Text: Ma'am? Please don't touch that. That is not a toy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh I'm sorry. I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How old are you?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I hate you.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [to Kevin] Honestly, is there any way you can get on your fiancee's plan? Our health plan is s... just... it's terrible.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There you are. Good news. Did some research. It turns out that 98% of people with skin cancer fully recover.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Still scary.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, but it's not brain cancer. And it shouldn't stop us from having fun. You know what they say the best medicine is.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well the doctor said a combination of interferon and dicarbazine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And laughter... also.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I don't really think people are in the laughing mood.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why are you here? I didn't even invite you to my birthday party.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I work here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [mocking voice] Nyeh, I work here. [to Kevin] Alright, well, you know what, since Toby doesn't speak for everybody and I am your boss, I... think you should just go home. Take the rest of the afternoon off. Take a sick day.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: If I go home now, I'll just drive myself crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, you're pretty much driving everyone else here crazy... crazy with worry.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Where have you been? And don't say the bathroom, 'cause I kicked in all the stalls.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well that's an invasion of privacy, so, I'm going to tell Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Please, don't.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You... owe me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Excuse me, everyone. Attention please. Kevin, we're going to take you to a very special place, a place that will make you happy, and a place that is far, far away from the evil sun.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Is this trip related in any way to your... birthday?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How dare you sir. You are gross.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sees 'Happy Birthday Michael Scott!' poster at skating rink] That should not be there.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll get someone to take it down.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, it's alright. It's already up. Just leave it. Where's Kevin? Come on! Let's get our skate on!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Don't be scared! You're good! You're good!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Think you can let go?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa. [Michael skates by]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: YEAH!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Who is that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is that Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I've been pretty much skating my whole life. I thought about playing in the NHL, but, you're on the road so much. You got no time to spend with your wife and kids. And I really want a wife and kids.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I got it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey Pam, all this stuff with Kevin... um, it's pretty scary. And I'm thinking that uh, next time you're in the shower, you should check yourself out. You know, give yourself an exam. Those things are like ticking time bags. Alright? Think about it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: ...It's something to think about.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I can't relax about it, you know?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kevin. You heard anything yet?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No, not yet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Well. Live strong.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Okay, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. Carol? She sold me my condo! Hey! What, is this place on the market? Or...

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Uhh, no, I... don't just sell real estate. Uh, my daughter has a skating lesson.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, these... all your kids?

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: No just the front two.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, hey guys. Whats up? You wanna go for a ride? Is that okay?

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Cool. Alright. Grab on. Here we go. Ready? Hang on tight. Alright. We are moving. We are reaaallly mooovin' now!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Push. Good! That's great. You got it. [Kevin's phone rings] Excuse me.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hello? Yeah okay. Alright. Okay, I will, thanks. [hangs up] It was negative.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh... God... [stomps] God! [throws hockey stick and yellow paper bracelet down] We're gonna beat this, okay? We're gonna... come here [hugs Kevin].

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, apparently in the medicine community, negative means good. Which makes absolutely no sense. In the real world community, that would... be... chaos.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: This is awesome. Thanks, you guys.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, who's this from? Wowwwee, look at that! Jersey!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Turn it around. Turn it around.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Cool. Ohh. Great. From Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Number one!!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you... Dwight. That's great. Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: This is from all of us.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh! You didn't need to do that. ...Nightswept. This is... really amazing. Thank you. I love it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael's birthday was actually pretty cool. It was a good day. I don't know... It was a good day.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael's birthday. It's pretty fun to watch, actually. He gets very excited, and then he eats a lot of cake. And then he runs around the office. Then he has a sugar crash in the afternoon. And then he falls asleep. And that's when we get our work done.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's get the party started.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's not how I taught you, right? [singing] My hump, my hump, my lovely lady lump Check it out [Dwight imitating drumbeat]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael's birthday is hard for me because he gets very excited. But he's also under a lot of pressure, which builds up until he's ready to explode. As his right-hand man, it's my job to release that pressure so that he can enjoy himself, if only for a moment.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, here's the thing about bosses and employees. A good boss will say, "Hey, it's my birthday. Celebrate me." A great boss will say, "Hey, it's my birthday. Celebrate yourselves, because you are the ones who made me great, and I will acknowledge your contributions with donuts."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good. You know, Ryan, you didn't have to get me a present.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I won't.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good. Great.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay, good. I think I'm gonna go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I think you're gonna stay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: On my 20th birthday, my supposed best friend, Sam Ambrose, ditched me for his twin sister's Sweet Sixteen party. And that was my worst birthday. Until today.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Can you please stop staring at me? [Dwight continues to stare and then walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: To think that a man's skin could turn on him. It's brilliant, 'cause you'd never expect it. Most people think of their skin as an ally. [scoffs] Makes me rethink having skin at all.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [knock on door] Mmm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey. I got the information.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, good. Okay. Don't tell me, tell them.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [turns to camera] "The survival rate for localized melanoma is 98%."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, my God. That's a piece of cake. That's a piece of cake. Oh, 2%. Jeez, that's good.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [looking at camera] "There was 7,800 deaths from melanoma in 2005."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Out of, like, 18 billion Americans, so, no worry.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: "For localized melanoma, the five-year survival rate is 98%. The survival rates for regional and..."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Those were probably misdiagnosed. I mean, anybody with a zit goes in and says, "I have cancer."

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: "The skin is the largest organ of the body."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Untrue. The heart is bigger than the skin. If you stretched the heart out, it would cover more than the entire body.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'm not afraid of dying. I know where I'm going. But if I were Kevin, I might be terrified. Gluttony.
